docs.snippet: The word “together” has become loaded in the Grizzlies-Thunder series, which involves teams with different philosophies. One operates a sharing-is-caring offensive system, while the other relies on a superstar tandem....
docs.lead_paragraph: The word “together” has become loaded in the Grizzlies-Thunder series, which involves teams with different philosophies. One operates a sharing-is-caring offensive system, while the other relies on a superstar tandem.
docs.abstract: Scott Cacciola On Pro Basketball column analyzes playoff series between Memphis Grizzlies and Oklahoma City Thunder; argues that while Grizzlies have a balanced, team-based offense, the Thunder relies heavily on superstar tandem of Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook.

headline.seo: Grizzlies Defense Pushes Limits of Durant-Westbrook Tandem
headline.main: A Test of Togetherness That One Team Is Passing
headline.print_headline: A Balanced Threat to a Two-Man Show

docs.snippet: Mike Dunleavy scored 35 points, Jimmy Butler hit a go-ahead 3-pointer with 24 seconds remaining, and the Chicago Bulls hung on for a 100-97 win over the host Washington Wizards....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Dunleavy scored 35 points, Jimmy Butler hit a go-ahead 3-pointer with 24 seconds remaining, and the Chicago Bulls hung on for a 100-97 win over the host Washington Wizards.
docs.abstract: Chicago Bulls beat Washington Wizards, 100-97, trimming their deficit in playoff series to 2-1.

headline.print_headline: Bulls Edge Wizards to Close Gap

docs.snippet: The Raptors, who entered the fourth quarter trailing by 11, trimmed the Nets’ lead to 97-96 but fell behind in the series, 2-1....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Raptors, who entered the fourth quarter trailing by 11, trimmed the Nets’ lead to 97-96 but fell behind in the series, 2-1.
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets beat Toronto Raptors, 102-98, earning 2-1 lead in playoff series.

headline.main: Nets Avoid Collapse and Put the Raptors in a Hole
headline.print_headline: Nets Nearly Collapse, but End Up Standing Tall

docs.snippet: It may be time to do away with the one-year rule, which since 2006 has effectively required players to spend at least a year in college before entering the N.B.A. draft....
docs.lead_paragraph: It may be time to do away with the one-year rule, which since 2006 has effectively required players to spend at least a year in college before entering the N.B.A. draft.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column argues that it may be time to do away with NBA's one-year rule, which effectively requires players to spend at least a year in college before entering the draft.

headline.main: Given a Choice, Athletes May Prefer None and Done
headline.print_headline: Given a Choice, Athletes May Prefer None and Done

docs.snippet: Kentucky’s twin freshman guards, Aaron and Andrew Harrison, will return for a second season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kentucky’s twin freshman guards, Aaron and Andrew Harrison, will return for a second season.
docs.abstract: Aaron and Andrew Harrison, twin freshman guards for University of Kentucky, will both return for second season despite both being mentioned as possible first-round picks in NBA draft; other college basketball news noted.

headline.main: Twin Guards Are Staying at Kentucky

docs.snippet: They're often thrown like rag dolls and risk being stepped on or gored by bucking bulls and broncos. But in those few seconds in the spotlight of the Angola Prison Rodeo, the inmates feel like they are part of the world again....

docs.snippet: Northwestern’s scholarship football players voted whether to unionize on Friday, but the outcome may not be known for months....
docs.lead_paragraph: Northwestern’s scholarship football players voted whether to unionize on Friday, but the outcome may not be known for months.
docs.abstract: Northwestern University's scholarship football players vote on whether to certify first union in college sports, landmark event that is closely watched by NCAA and politicians across country; votes will be impounded until National Labor Relations Board can review previous decision by regional official, meaning they will likely not be counted for months.

headline.main: Waiting Game Follows Union Vote by Northwestern Players
headline.print_headline: Waiting Game Follows Union Vote by Northwestern Players
